data.body: I suspect this `false` was debugging code that got commited. I see now downside to actually using `swimForce` as intended. Works in my build.

data.title: 3 textures blending fix
data.body:
While working with the terrain blending, I found some artifacts when having more than 2 textures blended together.
Steve_Yorkshire in IRC confirmed that he had also seen the issue, so I dug into it and found that the textures aren't blended properly. This PR fixes specifically the blending between the 2nd and the third texture.

Image of the issue here:
![Blend artifacts](http://imagizer.imageshack.us/a/img822/2708/7zci.png)

With this PR it looks like this:
![Blend fixed](http://imagizer.imageshack.us/a/img823/3235/z5w9.png)

data.title: Cannot use .. in file paths
data.body: That's kind of unacceptable. Let's fix it.

data.title: Alpha Skyboxes that can use lighting
data.body: Both types of cloud layers have a setting to appear in front of or behind the skybox.  Normal skyboxes need no changes.  Alpha skybox material needs transparency checked in the material editor.

data.title: Executable always exits with status 0
data.body: For unit testing and CI (#677), it would be useful to have the engine exit with status 1 if tests failed. Right? Anyway, currently that doesn't happen. `TorqueMain` always returns 0, which is actually the value of `keepRunning` in `StandardMainLoop`. Which doesn't seem helpful.

data.title: Cloned Dynamic Cubemaps bad.
data.body:
Instancing clones the results of a previously used material to it's next instance. As such, it and Dynamic Cube Mapping are mutually exclusive features.

Working on a more extensive approach when it comes to consistency: https://github.com/Azaezel/Torque3D/tree/tsstatic_DynamicCubemaps but that may take a few additionally divergent turns, so for now just noting the raw fix to existing functionality.

data.title: Screen-to-world calculations are not correct
Fix: Null'ed pointer usage, possible access violation.
data.body: This fixes issue #700

data.title: Null'ed pointer usage, possible access violation.
data.body:
We can get an access violation in classes `Debris` and `Splash` inside `::onRemove()` methods:

`getSceneManager()->removeObjectFromScene(this);
getContainer()->removeObject(this);`

Inside the `removeObjectFromScene()` we can find a line: `getContainer()->removeObject()`. So, it's already called and not needed.

To make this act like the the all other classes, we need to replace this with the single line: `removeFromScene();`

P.S.
We are lucky that `vftable` is being used when we kick `removeObject()` on `NULL` container (which is returned from the `getContainer()`) and the container itself is not touched inside, so no crash happens.

PR will be pushed in a bit.

data.title: Append ' DLL' to DLL name to fix linker times

milestone.description: This release is the first that the new Steering Committee will be responsible for. Our aims are to process as many existing outstanding issues/pull requests as possible and implement good practises for the future of the engine, such as automatic compile/unit testing of pull requests, as well as managing the different release files.

data.body:
As reported in #72, the DLL having the same name as the EXE was causing long link times in Visual Studio. This commit renames the DLL to have an _ after the project name, fixing the link times. I should mention, @LuisAntonRebollo is responsible for this. I'm just requesting it officially...

Possibility: on load, the engine should look for DLLs with and without the underscore, so if you find it really obnoxious you can rename your DLL before shipping.

data.title: Cannot create empty ShapeBaseImageData block
data.body: As noted in [this thread](http://www.garagegames.com/community/forums/viewthread/137051), attempting to create a `ShapeBaseImageData` block results in a failure if no parent block is specified. This needs to be fixed either in the editor, by allowing parameters to be added to the datablock before it is created, or in the engine, by allowing an empty datablock to exist.

data.title: Cannot use the same navmesh file with multiple meshes
data.body: As noted in [this thread](http://www.garagegames.com/community/forums/viewthread/137052), if you point two navmeshes at the same data file, the navmesh geometry of both meshes will end up in the same world location. This is because the geometry is saved in absolute (world) coordinates, rather than in coordinates relative to the navmesh's current location.

data.title: Cubemap R6025

data.title: Add support for Opus codec
data.body: Opus is the new Xiph.org open source wideband codec for sound, meant to supersede Vorbis and is similar in quality to AAC. Adding support for this would be an excellent feature to add in the future.

data.title: Buffers of type GFXBufferTypeVolatile may be discarded before drawing
data.body:
Buffers of the type GFXBufferTypeVolatile are currently unsuitable for storing vertex data within frames, unless you draw from the buffer before requesting a new buffer. This is fine for drawing stuff such as the GUI and debug elements, but not so suitable for drawing prepared objects such as particle emitters and skinned shapes.

For instance, lets say the following:
- We have 3 particle emitters which have a GFXBufferTypeVolatile buffer of 100 verts each
- The storage buffer which backs each volatile buffer is 400 verts long, and is currently at position 300

If we start preparing verts for all 3 of our particle emitters, what will happen is as follows:
- Emitter 1 will allocate 100 verts at position 300
- Emitter 2 will detect we are at the end of the buffer, set the position back to 0, and _DISCARD_ the entire buffer, and allocate 100 verts at position 0
- Emitter 3 will allocate 100 verts at position 100

When we render these emitters in the render bins, Emitter 1 will essentially be rendering from junk data since Emitter 2 discarded the buffer.

Ideally there needs to be another vertex buffer type such as GFXBufferTypeVolatileFrame which works like GFXBufferTypeVolatile with the following differences:
- If the buffer marker passes the end, look for another storage buffer of the same vertex format.
- If no storage buffer is found, allocate a new one

data.title: projectGenerator.command "PHP Fatal error:  Cannot redeclare class Generator"
data.body:
http://pastebin.com/TsY6rqnL

I would try to push a commit with the modified files but I have no clue how to do so. Apologies on that note.

You can see on the PasteBin, my terminal output when trying to execute "projectGenerator.command" to create the needed make files. My PHP version is 5.5 from the Ubuntu repository.

I had to do a "Find & Replace" for the string "Generator" in every file that gave me the fatal errors and change "Generator" to "GeneratorX". This allowed projectGenerator to execute with no further errors and I was then able to build from source without a single problem.

If you'd like any further information, please fire away :)

Thanks guys.
